item.title: A long successful career in IT (women in tech)
item.description: Tanya Janca and Franziska Buehler of the OWASP Project DevSlop discuss their long and very successful careers in IT. The ups and the downs. Q & A WHY This talk is to both encourage other women in IT, and also to help everyone understand the challenges that women sometimes face by working in information technology. What Mostly success stories, with a few war stories. Outcomes (…) References (…) Previous–>

item.title: Adding Privacy by Design in Secure Application Development
item.description: The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) has arrived! One monumental change is the introduction of Privacy by Design. In this keynote we will focus on the Privacy by Design (PbD) implications for developers. Two cornerstones for a successful implementation of PbD will be pitched: the integration of GDPR in a Secure Development Lifecycle approach threat modeling and GDPR risk patterns Link to the presentation: https://www.slideshare.net/sdeleersnyder/toreon-adding-privacy-by-design-in-secure-application-development-oss18-v20180608

item.title: Crossing the river by feeling the stones
item.description: Deng Xiaoping once described managing the economy as crossing the river by feeling the stones—in other words have a direction but be adaptive. But in a world of constant change, how do you determine the right thing to do? Which pebble to tread on? How do you understand where you’re going and where you need to go? How do you know if your strategy is right? Is there even such a thing?
